intro: Sayeria otaguroana, commonly known as the Otago bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Sayeria otaguroana is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
